UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA
UNIVERSITY PARK
LOS ANGELES 7
April 30, 1958
Professor Sam L. Becker, Chairman
FAEB Research Committee
Division of Television-Radio-Film
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam,
Mary thanks for your thoughtful memorandum of April 2iu I
am unable to be in Columbus during the Institute, so I am taking
this opportunity to put some remarks on paper.
Hopefully, most or all of the $2,000 would be used for grants
in aid, if projects of sufficient merit are presented. Probably
the general purpose of these grants could be to encourage research
of a higher quality instead of merely more research. I am able
to think of very little research in which the committee may not
be interested, if that research is proposed by a competent researcher
who has knowledge of educational broadcasting.
Yes, the announcement of grants should be out by mid September,
at latest. I hope that we would have enough applications of
sufficient merit to leave no money for research by the committee.
would favor publication of some kind by the oommittee, and I
would give first priority to the publishing of the report of the
Tresearch seminar. I see no special need for a separate meeting
of the committee at this time. In my view, the best procedure
for increasing the probability that sound research will be done
with NAEB funds would be to broaden the abilities of the members
of the committee.
The kind of person who would be best as director of research
is the same kind of person who would be best as a member of this
committee, I think. That kind of person should have advanced
understanding of mathematics, psychology, and educational broadÂ¬
casting. He should be able to carry forth erudite researchs and
to be most responsive to the day by day needs of operating educational
broadcasters.
Please give Irv Merrill my support in his request that
questions about radio and television be included in the I960 census
